content.content: 大将は到るところで厚遇された
The general was welcomed―made much of―made a lion of―lionized―f?ted―wherever he went.
He is hospitable to his guests―He keeps open house.
婦人はしきりに珍客を厚遇した
She was assiduous in her attentions to her honoured guest.

We made good our retreat while the rear-guard held the enemy in check.

〈名〉

content.content: The prices fluctuate―The prices are subject to fluctuations.

content: 2. (=品質の高下)qualities

The articles are of various qualities―various in quality.

〈名〉A sight; a spectacle; a scene; an effect

content.content: It is a fine sight―a grand sight.
It is an inspiring sight―a spirit-stirring scene.
被害地は惨憺たる光景を呈している
The districts affected present a pitiful spectacle―a deplorable spectacle.
その光景筆紙に尽し難
The sight is beautiful beyond description―The sight baffles description―The sight beggars description.
その光景は見るも恐ろしかった
The scene was fearful to behold.
軍艦に電飾を施すと美しい光景だ
When the ships are illuminated, the effect is beautiful.
だいたいの光景を観察する
to observe the general effect―the tout ensemble
この絵は日本軍隊がロシア艦を攻撃せんとする光景である
The picture represents the Japanese fleet attacking the Russian.

〈名〉The vital point

content.content: to hit the mark―hit the (right) nail on the head
彼の批評はいつも肯綮にあたる
His criticism always hits the right nail on the head.
この人物評は肯綮にあたらぬ
The characterization does not hit the mark.

content:
こうげい〔工芸〕
〈名〉The industrial arts; technology:(=の) technological

〈名〉The sum; the total; the sum total; the aggregate:(副詞に用いれば)total; in the aggregate; in all; altogether:(=する) to total, sum up, add up, foot up (the figures)

content.content: What do you make the total?―What does the total come to?
The total amounts to 1,000 yen―The total come to 1,000 yen―The total foots up to 1,000 yen―It totals 1,000 yen―It aggregates 1,000 yen.
Total, 1,000 yen―1,000 yen in the aggregate.
The total number is 300―There are 300 in all―There are 300 all told.
歳入の合計が五百億円に達した
The total amount of the revenue has reached 50,000,000,000 yen.

content:

〈名〉Good times; flush times; a flush; a boom:(形容詞に用いれば)good (times); active (market); brisk (trade); lively (business, etc.)

content.content: The silk trade is showing activity.
そのころは欧州戦乱のために海運業は非情な好景気であった
Owing to the European war, the shipping trade was extremely brisk at the time.
The business is doing very well.
震災後労働者は一般に好景気だ
Most labourers have been doing well since the seismic disaster.

content:
こうけいしゃ〔後継者〕
〈名〉A successor

content.content: 彼が去ったら誰が後継者になるか
If he leaves, who will succeed him in his office?―succeed to his post?―take his place?
(彼が去るので)後継者を物色している
We are looking out for a man to take his place.

content:
こうげき〔攻撃〕
〈名〉
1. (=攻め撃つこと)an attack; an assault; an onset; an onslaught; a storm:(defence に対し)offence:(=する) to attack (the enemy); to assail, assault (a fort); to storm (a fortress); to fall upon, set upon (a party):(攻撃をとるの意味なら)to assume the aggressive; to take the offensive; to act on the offensive

content.content: to make an attack―deliver an assault―on the enemy
四方から攻撃を受けた
We were attacked on every side.
to repel an attack―repulse an attack
to bear the brunt of the attack―stand in the breach―stand in the gap
港は明けっぱなしで攻撃を招く
The harbour lies open to attack.
to assail a fort―deliver an assault on a fort
to storm a fortress―make an attempt on a fortress
to take the enemy in front
to take the enemy in the rear
to take the enemy in the flank
to make an air attack―make an air raid
to take the enemy by surprise―take the enemy at a disadvantage―take the enemy at vantage―take the enemy unawares
to be taken by surprise―taken at vantage―taken unawares
to hurl oneself on the enemy
暗夜に乗じて攻撃する
to deliver an assault under cover of night
濃霧に乗じて水雷攻撃を行う
to make a torpedo-attack under favour of a fog
最も有力なる防御は攻撃なり
The most effective defence is offence.

content: 2. (=非難)an attack; a charge; censure; condemnation; denunciation:(=する) to attack, make an attack, on (a person); to charge (one with a crime); to censure (one for one's conduct); to condemn, damn (a new work); to denounce (one's conduct); to rail at, rail against (a custom); to talk against, write against (a man); to cry out against, exclaim against, declaim against (injustice, etc.)

content.content: A newspaper makes an attack on a man.
彼は新聞の攻撃くらいは慣れているから平気だ
He is quite used to newspaper attacks.
あれほど攻撃された人も無いものだ
Few men have been so much talked against and written against.
to censure one for one's conduct―denounce one's conduct
そんなことをすると世間の攻撃を招く
If you do such a thing, you will lay yourself open to censure―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such conduct will lay you open to censure.
新著述などを攻撃する
to condemn a new work―damn a new work
彼はこれを攻撃して完膚無からしめた
He tore it to pieces―pulled it to pieces―picked it to pieces.
世間で人の非道などをやかましく攻撃する
The public cry out against injustice―raise an outcry against injustice―raise a hue and cry against injustice.
君の行動に対して世間の攻撃の声がやかましい
The public are crying out against your conduct.
彼は堂々と政府を攻撃した
He declaimed against―thundered against―fulminated against―the government.
彼ははげしく敵を攻撃する
He is severe upon his enemies.
彼らは連合して彼を攻撃した
They made a dead set at him.
総理大臣はいつも攻撃の焦点になる
The Premier is always the focus of attack.
to make a personal attack―indulge in personalities

〈名〉A play-lover; a play-goer

〈名〉The Imperial Palace

to put the people under the screw―put the screw on the people

〈形〉High; high-minded; lofty; noble; pure

content.content: 彼は高潔な性格を備えている
He is a man of high character.
He is a high-minded man―a man of high principles.
高潔な思想を懐いている
高潔な心を持っている
He has a noble heart―a pure heart.
僕は彼の高潔なところを敬慕する
I admire him for the nobility of his heart―for the purity of his heart.

content:
ごうけつ〔豪傑〕
〈名〉A great man; a hero

content.content: He is a great man in his way.
He has something of the hero in his composition―He is cast in heroic mould.
He has something of the hero about him.
to set up for a hero―play the hero
あの少年は将来豪傑になる
The boy has in him the making of a great man.
(one of) the great ones of the land

content:
こうけっか〔好結果〕
〈名〉A good result; a success

content.content: to produce a good result―prove a success
戦争は好結果を来たした
The war has produced good results―been productive of good results.
ご尽力は好結果を来たしました
彼の試験は好結果であった
He has passed a successful examination―passed his examination with flying colours.
十六インチ砲の試験は好結果であった
The trial of the 16-in. gun gave very good results.
試みは好結果であった
The attempt proved a success―proved successful.

content:
こうけん〔後見〕
〈名〉
1. Guardianship; wardship; ward; tutelage:(=する) to act as guardian to (a child); to have the wardship of (a child); to look after

content.content: Theirs is the relation of guardian and ward.
子どもに後見をつける
to put a child under ward―put a child in ward
彼はまだ後見を受けている、後見つきの身だ
He is still a ward―under ward―under wardship―under tutelage.
伯(叔)父の後見を受けている
He is his uncle's ward―in ward to his uncle―under his uncle's guardianship.
彼は甥の後見をしている
He acts as guardian to his nephew―He has the wardship of his nephew.
彼はまだ若いから後見が要る
He is young, and wants looking after―(米国では)―needs looking after.

content: 2. (=役者の後見)prompting

こうけん〔公権〕
〈名〉Civil rights

content.content: to deprive a man of his civil rights

content:
こうけん〔効験〕
〈名〉Efficacy; virtue (of a medicine); (to have) effect (on one); (to do one) good:(=ある) efficacious

content.content: The medicine has a miraculous virtue―The medicine works wonders―The efficacy is miraculous.
この薬は脚気に著しい効験がある
The medicine is of remarkable efficacy in curing beriberi.
The medicine has taken effect―done me good.
この薬を飲んでも少しも効験が無い
The medicine has no effect on me―The medicine has done me no good.
温泉は効験がありましたか
Have the hot springs done you any good?
たいそう効験がありました
They have done me much good.

content:
こうけん〔貢献〕
〈名〉Service; contribution:(=する) to serve, render service to, deserve well of (one's country); to contribute to (success); to conduce to (prosperity); to go far towards, do much towards (some result)

content.content: to serve one's country―render service to the State―deserve well of the country
この学校はだいぶ公共に貢献している
The school has rendered great service to the public.
彼の助力は事業の成功に少なからず貢献している
His assistance has contributed not a little to the success of the enterprise.
米国の加盟は同盟軍の勝利に大いに貢献している
America's participation in the war contributed greatly to―went a long way towards―the victory of the Allies.
日本海の海戦は平和克復後に大いに貢献している
The Battle of the Japan Sea contributed much to―went far towards―did much towards―the restoration of peace.
本校の設立は斯道の発達に貢献するところ多かるべし
The establishment of the school will contribute much to―go far towards―do much towards―the progress of the study.
この政策は国運の発展に貢献するところあるべし
The policy will conduce to the prosperity of the country.

content:
こうげん〔公言〕
〈名〉Declaration; profession; avowal; proclamation:(=する) to declare; to profess; to avow; to proclaim

content.content: 彼は事件にはいっさい関係が無いと公言している
He declares that he is not concerned in the affair.
彼は満足の意を公言した
He professed himself to be quite content.
彼はその文を草したことを隠さず公言している
He avows himself to be the author of the article.
彼の国賊なることは天下に公言してはばからぬ
I will proclaim from the housetop that he is a traitor.

content:
こうげん〔巧言〕

content.content: 巧言令色鮮{すくな}し仁

〈名〉Free talk; unreserved speech:(=する) to talk freely; to speak without reserve

〈名〉A retort:(=する) to retort; to talk back

〈名〉A plateau; a table-land

〈名〉A boast; big talk; tall talk:(=する) to boast; to talk big; to talk tall

content.content: to talk in a lofty strain―talk boastfully
彼がそんな高言を吐くのを聞いて片腹痛かった
I was tickled to hear him talk in such a lofty strain.
彼は人の世話にならぬと高言した

こうげん〔曠原〕
〈名〉A wide plain; a vast plain

ごうけん〔剛健〕
〈形〉Vigorous (style); sturdy (youth); stout (heart); stalwart (frame); virile (spirit, etc.)

こうげんきん〔絞絃琴〕
〈名〉A hurdy-gurdy

content:

〈名〉

content.content: お父様のお眼鏡で私を後見人に立てられたのだ

content: 2. (=役者の後見人)a prompter

こうこ〔後顧〕
〈名〉Looking back; solicitude about one's home; family cares (which obstructs one's freedom of action)

content.content: One is solicitous about one's home―One has family cares.
賢婦は夫をして後顧の憂い無からしむ
A wise wife will free you from family cares.
戦線に立てる将士をして後顧の憂い無からしめよ
Let the officers and men at the front be freed from solicitude about their homes.
後顧の憂いがあっては充分に働けぬ
Solicitude about one's home will hinder one's activity.
後顧の憂いなく思いきって遊んでみたい
I should like to have my fling free from care.

彼は妻を離縁して後顧の憂いを絶った
He divorced his wife to free himself from care.

こうこ〔好個〕

content.content: 殖民地には好個の場所である

content:

content.content: He has a taste for antiquarianism.

content:

content.content: It is a study for an archaeologist.

content:
こうご〔交互〕
〈名〉
1. (=交代)alternation:(=の) alternate:(=に) alternately; by turns
2. (=相互)reciprocity:(=の) reciprocal; mutual:(=に) reciprocally; mutually; each other

〈名〉The spoken language:(=の) colloquial

content.content: 今はたいがい口語体になった
Most writers now write in colloquial style.

content:

〈副〉Hereafter; henceforth; in future; for the future

content.content: You must be more careful in future.

content.content: (契約)a valid contract―(約束)―a binding promise―(法律)―an effective law―a law in force―(演説)―an effective speech―(切符)―an avail able ticket―a good ticket

(契約)―an invalid contract―(約束)―a promise of no force―(法律)―an invalid law―an ineffective law―(演説)―an ineffective speech―(切符)―an unavailable ticket―a bad ticket
強制されてなせる約束は効力が無い
A promise made under compulsion is not binding―of no force―of no legal force.
この契約はもう効力が無い
The agreement is now invalid―null―null and void―of no effect―of no legal effect.
この証文はもう効力が無い
The deed is now null―null and void―of no effect―of no legal effect―(時効の為なら)―barred by prescription.
いまさら奔走しても効力があるまい
To bestir myself at the time of day―will be ineffective―will be of no effect―will do no good.
(契約なら)to take effect―become valid―(約束なら)―become binding―(法律なら)―become effective―come into effect―come into force―become operative
本条約は批准の上効力を生ず
The present treaty takes effect on ratification.

(契約なら)to lose effect―become invalid―lose its validity―become null and void―(約束なら)―cease to be binding―(法律なら)―become ineffective―become void―go out of force―(切符なら)―become unavailable―cease to be available
そういう場合にはこの約束は効力を失う

途中でちょっと下車しても切符は効力を失いませんか

〈名〉A knife; a pen-knife; a pocket-knife

content.content: to cut anything with a knife
to whittle anything with a knife
to cut a pencil with a knife―sharpen a pencil with a knife
この小刀はよく切れる
The edge of the knife is nicked―The knife is blunted.
あの男は小刀が切れ過ぎる

content:
こがたなざいく〔小刀細工〕
〈名〉A petty device; a petty artifice; a temporizing measure; a makeshift

content.content: よく小刀細工をやる男だ
He will resort to petty devices―He is a man of makeshifts.

content:
こかつ〔涸渇〕
〈名〉
1. (=涸れ乾くこと)drying up:(=する) to be dried up; to be parched

content.content: 干ばつのために田畑が涸渇した
The drought has dried up the fields―The fields are dried up―parched―owing to the drought.

content: 2. (=尽きること、乾涸)exhaustion; drain:(=する) to be exhausted; to be drained

content.content: 戦争があると国家の財源が涸渇する
A war will drain the country's resources―A war is a drain on the country's resources.

content:
ごがつ〔五月〕
〈名〉May

content.content: The Edokko is the streamer gay
Of the Boy's F?te of May;
For all that he may say.

content:
こがね〔黄金〕
〈名〉Gold

こがね〔小金〕
〈名〉A small sum of money

content.content: あの女は小金を持っている

こがねいろ〔黄金色〕
〈名〉A golden colour:(=の) golden

こがねむし〔黄金虫〕
〈名〉The May-beetle; the cockchafer

content:
こがら〔小柄〕
〈形〉(A man)of a small build

content.content: 小柄で気の利いた男だ
He is a dapper little fellow.

content:
こがらし〔木枯し〕
〈名〉A wintry blast

content.content: Now is the time when wintry blasts begin to blow.

content:
こがれじに〔焦れ死に〕
〈名〉Death from love:(=する) to die of love; to pine away for love

content.content: 二人は焦れ死にするほど会いたがっている
They are dying to see each other.

content:
こがれる〔焦がれる〕
〈他動〉To sigh for, die for (some one); pine for, languish for (something)

content.content: 君に焦がれている人がある
Some one is sighing for you―dying for you.
あの娘は恋に焦がれている
She pines for love―languishes for love.
その時の来るのを待ち焦がれている
How I long for that time to come!
待ち焦がれた日になりました
The long wished-for day has come.

こがわ〔小川〕
〈名〉A brook; a rivulet; a stream

content:
こがわせ〔小為替〕
〈名〉A postal note

content.content: I sent 100 yen in postal notes.

ごかん〔五官〕
〈名〉The five organs of sense; the sensory organs

content:
ごかん〔五感〕
〈名〉The five senses

content.content: 五感に触れる(ものは物質界)
The material world appeal to the senses.

ごかん〔冱寒〕
〈名〉Severe cold; intense cold

content:
こき〔古稀〕
〈名〉Seventy years of age; three score and ten; the allotted span

content.content: the celebration of one's seventieth birthday

こぎ〔古義〕
〈名〉The old interpretation (of a text)

content:
こぎ〔狐疑〕
〈名〉Doubt; hesitation; vacillation:(=する) to doubt; to hesitate; to vacillate; to waver

こぎ〔漕ぎ〕
〈名〉A pull; a stroke

ごき〔語気〕
〈名〉
1. (=語調) tone

content.content: 彼は怒った語気で談じておった
He was talking in an angry tone.
あの語気ではひどく怒っているようだ
Judging from his tone, he seems to be fearfully angry.
彼は辛辣な語気で人を攻撃する
He attacks people in caustic tones―in acrimonious tones.
毒々しい語気で人を評す
He comments on people in rancorous tones―in malignant tones.
毒々しい語気で人に食ってかかる
to attack a man with rancour
彼の言うことはなんとなく人を安心させる語気がある
There is something reassuring in his tone.
to emphasize one's words―lay stress on one's words

content: 2. (=言葉)words; terms; language

content.content: これは嘆願の語気でない
This is not the language of supplication.
請願書の語気が不穏当だ
The petition is couched in unfitting terms―couched in insolent terms.
烈しい活動をする人は語気も荒い
Men of intense activity will use violent language.
彼の語気は気取っている
彼は傲慢な語気を出す

ごぎ〔語義〕
〈名〉The meaning of a word; the acceptation of a word

content:
こきおとす〔扱き落す〕
〈他動〉To pass (anything long) through the hand and strip (it) of its appendages

content.content: to pass a mulberry twig through the hand and strip it of its leaves

content:
ごきげん〔御機嫌〕
〈名〉(Honorific for good or ill) humour; health

content.content: He is in good humour today.
He is in bad humour―in ill humour―out of humour―cross―as cross as two sticks.
彼はこの話が出るとご機嫌が悪い
He is sore on the subject.
to pay one's respects to a superior―(芸人なら)―perform to an audience
to court a person―try to please one's master―keep in favour with one's master
君はよくあの気むずかしい主人のご機嫌が取れるね
How do you manage to keep in the good graces of your fastidious master?
彼は主人のご機嫌を損じている
He is in disgrace with his master.
ご機嫌麗わしく還御あらせらる
His Majesty returned in excellent health.
殿はご機嫌斜めならず

content: 〈形〉(To be) in liquor, elevated, glorious

content.content: 今日はたいそうご機嫌ですね

ごきげんよう〔御機嫌好う〕
〈間投詞〉(逢った時は)Good day!; How do you do?:(別れる時は) Farewell!; Good-bye!

content:
こきざみ〔小刻み〕
〈名〉Mincing steps

content.content: to walk with mincing steps―mince one's steps

content:
こぎだす〔漕ぎ出す〕
〈自動〉To begin rowing; to begin pulling; to row out; to pull out; to put off; to push off

content.content: かじ並び揃えてこぎだした
We began rowing―began pulling―with the oars keeping stroke.
to row out to sea―pull out to sea
風波を冒してこぎだした
We put off―pushed off―in the face of a raging sea.

content:
こきつかう〔扱き使う〕
〈他動〉To work (one) hard; to drive (one) hard; to put one's nose to the grindstone

content.content: あそこの主人は人をこき使う
He will work you hard―drive you hard―hold your nose to the grindstone―He is a hard master.
小僧どもはこき使われている
こればかりの給金でこんなにこき使われてはたまらん
I can't stand being worked so hard on such a pittance.

content:
こぎつける〔漕ぎ付ける〕
〈自動〉
1. (=漕いで着く)to row one's way to, pull one's way to (a place)

content.content: やっと本船へ漕ぎつけた
We pulled our way to our ship with difficulty.

content: 2. (=漸く達する)to work one's way to (a position); to struggle through (a course, etc.)

content.content: 彼は勉強ずくで今の地位までこぎつけたのだ
He has worked his way up to―won his way up to―his present position by dint of industry.
どうかこうか卒業までこぎつけました
I have managed to struggle through (my course).
ここまでこぎつければ成功は時日問題だ
Now that we have got so far, success is only a question of time.

content:
こぎって〔小切手〕
〈名〉(英国では)a cheque:(米国では)a check

content.content: to draw a cheque―issue a cheque
田中宛に千円の小切手を振り出す
I draw a cheque for 1,000 yen in favour of Mr. Tanaka.
to cash a cheque―honour a cheque
小切手の支払を証明する

こぎて〔漕手〕
〈名〉A rower; an oarsman

ごきない〔五畿内〕
〈名〉The five Home Provinces

content:
こきび〔小気味〕
〈名〉→『

こきぶつ〔古器物〕
〈名〉Antique utensils; articles of virtu; curios

content:
こきまぜる〔扱き混ぜる〕
〈他動〉To mix (things) together

content.content: I look out o'er a tangled mass
Of cherry's bloom and willows green;
A rich brocade of brilliant sheen.

content:
こきみ〔小気味〕
〈名〉A feeling (of exaltation, etc.)

content.content: 彼は小気味の好い演説をする
It does my heart good―warms the cockles of my heart―to hear him speak.
He is a spirited man―an energetic man.
小気味好く断ってやった
彼の新作を小気味好く批評した人がある
His new work has been mercilessly criticized.
彼は誰の事でも小気味好く攻撃する
彼は敵を倒して小気味好さそうに眺めている
あまり賞められて小気味が悪かった
I felt queer when I was praised.

こぎもどす〔漕ぎ戻す〕
〈自動〉To row back; to pull back

content:
こきゅう〔呼吸〕
〈名〉
1. (=息)breath; breathing; respiration:(=する) to breathe; to draw breath; to respire:(=の) respiratory

content.content: 病人は呼吸が迫って来た
The invalid is pressed for breath―hard of breathing.
The breathing is difficult―The respiration is laboured.
to feel a difficulty in breathing
I practise deep respiration every morning.
He was resuscitated by artificial respiration.
to choke one―stifle one―suffocate one―smother one
a disease of the respiratory organs―a chest complaint

content: 2. (=妙技、こつ)a knack; a trick; tact; craft

content.content: to get the knack―learn the trick
そこの呼吸を呑込むと後は楽だ
If you get the knack of doing it, you will find the rest easy.
やっと呼吸がわかった
I have now learned the trick of doing it.
to learn the tricks of the trade―learn the craft of the profession
その社会の呼吸を呑込む
to hit the tone of the society
教えるのは呼吸ものだ
そこの呼吸がむつかしい、呼吸がちょっとむつかしい、呼吸がなかなかむつかしい
The operation requires tact―requires some tact―requires a great deal of tact.
万事その呼吸で行くのだ
That's the way of doing everything.
理屈以外に呼吸というものがある
Besides mere theory, there is a something which must be acquired by practice.

こきゅう〔胡弓〕
〈名〉The Japanese fiddle

content:
こきゅうき〔呼吸器〕
〈名〉
1. (=呼吸器官)the respiratory organs

content.content: a disease of the respiratory organs―a chest complaint

content: 2. (=呼吸器械)a respirator

content.content: to wear a respirator―use a respirator

content:
こきょう〔故郷〕
〈名〉One's native place; one's native land (province, town, or village); one's birthplace; one's old home

content.content: How I long for a sight of my native land!―I have a longing for home―I am sick for home―I am homesick.
彼は故郷を恋しがっている
He longs for a sight of his native land―He has a longing for home―He pines for home.
to go home―return home―see one's native land
僕は生きて故郷に帰られまい
I shall never live to see my native land.
錦を来て故郷に帰る(故郷に錦を飾る)
to return home loaded with honours
故郷を出でてここに十年
It is ten years since I left home.
The place of one's birth is ever dear to one.
生れ故郷を後にして行く
to leave one's home behind one
彼らは生れ故郷を後にして万里の波濤を越えてくる
They leave their beloved homes behind them, and come over the seas.

ごきょう〔五経〕
〈名〉The Five Chinese Classics

ごぎょう〔五行〕
〈名〉The five elements (of Chinese philosophy―fire, water, wood, metal, and earth)

content:
こぎれい〔小綺麗〕
〈形〉Neat; natty; tidy; trim

content.content: 子どもらには小綺麗な身なりをさしておく
小綺麗な体裁の好い家だ
It is a trim, decent house.

こきん〔古金〕
〈名〉Old gold coins

content:
こく
〈他動〉

〈他動〉To pass (anything) through the hand

content.content: to pass a spear through the hand
to strip a mulberry twig of its leaves (by drawing it through the hand)

こく〔国〕
〈名〉A country; a state

content:
こく〔穀〕
〈名〉Grain; corn; cereals

content.content: The harvest is abundant―The crops are heavy.

content:
こく〔酷〕
〈形〉Severe (punishment); harsh (treatment); hard (master); strict (law); stringent (rules); rigid (disciplinarian); exacting (father); cruel (nature, etc.)

content.content: 人を酷な使いようをする
He is an exacting father―(は本当の父、長官などなら)―a rigid disciplinarian.
彼の僕に対する仕打ちが酷だ
He has dealt harshly by me.
He is strict in marking―a bad marker.
That's hard on me―rough on me.

こく〔石〕
〈名〉(穀物の石は)4.9629 bushels:(液量の石は)39.7033 gallons

こく〔轂〕
〈名〉The hub, the nave (of a wheel)

content:
こぐ〔漕ぐ〕
〈他動〉To row (a boat); to pull (an oar); to work at (the oar)

content.content: to pull an oar―work at the oar
to work a scull―scull a boat
彼は漕ぐことが上手だ
皆死力を尽して漕いだ
They worked convulsively at the oars.
舟を漕ぎにいかないか
Won't you go for a row?
湖水で舟を漕いでみたい
I should like to have a row on the lake.
船歌に合わせて舟を漕ぐ
The rowers keep time with song.
to pull one's way―row one's way―to the shore
漕ぎ損なう、漕ぎ損なってひっくりかえる

content:
ごく〔極〕
〈副〉Most; extremely

content.content: an article of the most superior quality
ごく善く見ても失錯だ
It is, at best, a blunder.
ごく悪く行ってもこの資本を棒に振るだけのことだ
I can but lose my capital at the worst.
ごく高く積っても一万円はかかるまい
It can not cost 10,000 yen at the highest estimate.
ごく安く積っても二万円はかかる
It will cost 20,000 yen at the lowest estimate.
He told me so in strict confidence.

content:
ごく〔獄〕
〈名〉A prison; a jail

content.content: to put one in prison―cast one into prison
to be imprisoned―in prison―laid by the heels―confined
獄につながれて善心に立帰る者は少ない
Few people grow better in prison.

content:
ごくあく〔極悪〕
〈形〉Diabolical (crime); fiendish (spirit); satanic (mind); hellish (scheme); infernal (rascal, etc.)

content.content: a double-dyed scoundrel―a scoundrel of the blackest dye
a crime of the deepest dye

content:
ごくあくひどう〔極悪非道〕
〈形〉→『

こくい〔国威〕
〈名〉National power; national prestige; national honour; national glory

content.content: to raise the national prestige―enhance the glory of the nation
The national prestige is raised―The glory of the nation is enhanced.
Japan must make her power felt.
(外からなら)to injure the national prestige―(内からなら)―compromise the national honour
これは国威に関する問題である
The question involves the national honour―It is a point of national honour.

content:
ごくい〔極意〕
〈名〉The mysteries (of an art)

content.content: to initiate one into the mysteries of the art
to be initiated into the mysteries of the art

content:
こくいっこく〔刻一刻〕
〈副〉Hourly; every hour; momently; every moment

content.content: 病人は刻一刻と悪くなる
The invalid grows worse and worse every moment―momently grows worse.
危険は刻一刻と迫って来る
Danger is imminent―There is imminent danger.

content:
こくいん〔極印〕
〈名〉A stamp (for marking plate)

content.content: to stamp plate with a mark
小判に前田家の極印が打ってあった
The Koban were stamped with the Maeda mark.

content:
ごくいん〔極印〕
〈名〉→『

こくう〔虚空〕
〈名〉Empty space

content.content: 虚空をつかんでもがく

content:
ごくう〔御供〕
〈名〉An offering; a sacrifice (to a deity)

こくうぞう〔虚空蔵〕
〈固名〉A Buddhistic god

content:
こくうん〔国運〕
〈名〉The fortunes of a country; the fate of a nation; the destiny of a land; national prosperity

content.content: 日本の国運はますます隆盛に赴く
Japan's fortunes are on the rise.
我が国運は青年の双肩にかかっている
The destiny or Japan rests on the rising generation.
この政策は国運の発展に貢献するところあるべし
The policy will conduce to the prosperity of the country.
物価騰貴は国運の消長に関する
The appreciation of prices affect the prosperity of the country.
May Japan long rejoice in peace and prosperity!
国運を賭して戦争をする
to stake the nation's fate on a war
Glory has departed from the land.

content:
こくうん〔黒雲〕
〈名〉Dark clouds
